titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the George Huntington Fisher biographical sketch 1977.602
titlestmt.author: Nicholas Pavlik
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

did.abstract: Photostat copy of a biographical sketch of George H. Fisher that appeared in an unidentified newspaper in 1908.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection consists of a single document.

bioghist.head: Biographical note
bioghist.p: George Huntington Fisher (1832-1910) was admitted to the New York bar in 1854 and was a member of the Brooklyn law firm Fisher, Hurd & Voltz. He was a trustee, secretary, and counsel of the German Savings Bank of Brooklyn and director of the Broadway Bank of Brooklyn. He married Emma Chichester (d. 1888) in 1857, with whom he had one child, George C. Fisher (b. 1858). After Emma's death, Fisher married Katharine Weeks. He resided until his death at 84 Broadway in Brooklyn.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); George Huntington Fisher biographical sketch, 1977.602, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Public Library, Center for Brooklyn History.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection was rehoused and the finding aid revised by Dee Bowers in 2023.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photostat copy of a biographical sketch of George H. Fisher that appeared in an unidentified newspaper in 1908.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: This item is in the public domain. While many items at the Center for Brooklyn History are unrestricted, we do not own reproduction rights to all materials. Be aware of the several kinds of rights that might apply: copyright, licensing and trademarks. The researcher assumes all responsibility for copyright questions.
